answer:
Women should avoid becoming pregnant for 1 month after getting the chickenpox vaccine.  This applies to any dose of the vaccine.
If you have further questions regarding this, we recommend that you speak with your health care provider. 
For more information about the chickenpox vaccine, see the HealthLinkBC File: Chickenpox Vaccine.
question: Chicken pox vaccine says not to get pregnant for 30 days after vaccine, is this 30 days after first vaccine or 30 days after booster 4 weeks later?
question_variation_0: when is a pregnancy after chicken pox vaccine
question_variation_1: can you get pregnant after chicken pox vaccine
question_variation_2: chicken pox vaccine how long after vaccine
